item.title: BPA-free may not necessarily be better for you
item.description:
Many plastic water bottles, especially those marketed for sports or children, highlight being “BPA free.” Public concern regarding bisphenol A (BPA) grew in 2008, leading many companies to adopt BPA replacements, particularly for products aimed at children and athletes. While the shift away from BPA in certain products might seem reassuring, issues remain. BPA is still commonly used in thermal receipt paper, can linings, and even water pipes, often without public disclosure...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/bpa-free-may-not-necessarily-be-better-for-you/
